original_data.question:
A 5-year-old boy is brought to his pediatrician’s office by his parents after they noticed blood in his urine. The child has been complaining of difficulty in passing urine and has lower abdominal pain. He seems more bloated than usual. On some occasions, he starts crying while passing urine, primarily because of a burning sensation. A urinalysis is performed, and the results are as follows:
Urine pH 6.2
Urine specific gravity 1.010
Glucose Negative
Ketones Negative
RBCs 1-2/hpf
WBCs 0-1/hpf
Casts 2-3/hpf
The pediatrician believes the boy has a bladder infection with a double-stranded DNA virus. Which of the following conditions is also commonly associated with this viral infection?

model_response:
The clinical findings are consistent with a diagnosis of cystitis caused by adenovirus. Gastroenteritis is a common finding in children with adenovirus infection. The other findings listed are not associated with adenovirus infection.

###Answer: OPTION A IS CORRECT.</s><s>

question_entities.definition: A medical doctor with specialized training in the care of children.
Persons functioning as natural, adoptive, or substitute parents. The heading includes the concept of parenthood as well as preparation for becoming a parent.
The body fluid that circulates in the vascular system (BLOOD VESSELS). Whole blood includes PLASMA and BLOOD CELLS.
Liquid by-product of excretion produced in the kidneys, temporarily stored in the bladder until discharge through the URETHRA.
A person 6 to 12 years of age. An individual 2 to 5 years old is CHILD, PRESCHOOL.
Something not easily done, accomplished, comprehended, or solved.
Production or presence of gas in the gastrointestinal tract which may be expelled through the anus.
Liquid by-product of excretion produced in the kidneys, temporarily stored in the bladder until discharge through the URETHRA.
Sensation of discomfort, distress, or agony in the abdominal region.
A question about whether an individual feels or felt bloated.
To utter an inarticulate, characteristic sound in order to communicate or express a feeling, or desire for attention.
Production or presence of gas in the gastrointestinal tract which may be expelled through the anus.
Liquid by-product of excretion produced in the kidneys, temporarily stored in the bladder until discharge through the URETHRA.
A sensation of stinging or heat, not necessarily accompanied by redness or physical signs of irritation.

The process in which specialized SENSORY RECEPTOR CELLS transduce peripheral stimuli (physical or chemical) into NERVE IMPULSES which are then transmitted to the various sensory centers in the CENTRAL NERVOUS SYSTEM.

Examination of urine by chemical, physical, or microscopic means. Routine urinalysis usually includes performing chemical screening tests, determining specific gravity, observing any unusual color or odor, screening for bacteriuria, and examining the sediment microscopically.
The result of a laboratory, radiologic, or other clinical test performed to determine the presence, absence, or degree of a condition.
Liquid by-product of excretion produced in the kidneys, temporarily stored in the bladder until discharge through the URETHRA.

The normality of a solution with respect to HYDROGEN ions; H+. It is related to acidity measurements in most cases by pH = log 1/2[1/(H+)], where (H+) is the hydrogen ion concentration in gram equivalents per liter of solution. (McGraw-Hill Dictionary of Scientific and Technical Terms, 6th ed)
Clearly and explicitly stated.

An absence finding of the specified component / analyte, organism or clinical sign based on the established threshold of the performed test or procedure.

\[Note: Negative does not necessarily imply the complete absence of the specified item.\]
A medical doctor with specialized training in the care of children.
Inflammation of the URINARY BLADDER, either from bacterial or non-bacterial causes. Cystitis is usually associated with painful urination (dysuria), increased frequency, urgency, and suprapubic pain.
RNA viruses that have their genetic material encoded in the form of double-stranded RNA.
A state of being, such as a state of health.
Joined in some kind of relationship.
A general term for diseases caused by viruses.
